snippet.title: Peak-hour pain after CBD tram smash
snippet.content:
MORE than a dozen people are being assessed after two trams collided in Melbourne's CBD this afternoon. The accident happened at the intersection of Bourke and Spencer streets at 2.40pm. Ambulance Victoria said 15 people were assessed at the scene. Six were treated for minor injuries while a pre-school child was taken to Royal Children's Hospital in a stable condition. Two people were taken to Royal Melbourne Hospital, also in a stable condition. No serious injuries were reported. Did you witness the accident? Contact our reporter Bourke St had been closed to traffic between King and Spencer streets, Victoria Police said. A Yarra Trams spokeswoman said crews were working to clear the scene as soon as possible but there would be some peak-hour delays with trams backed up along the tracks. Route 96 had no trams between Stop 4 at Queen St and Stop at 130 Middle Park with passengers urged to switch to Route 16 trams to and from St Kilda. Route 86 trams were diverting via La Trobe St between Victoria Pde and Spencer St. An earlier fault had affected other services in the area, but this had been rectified.
Originally published as
